meanings.definition: Causing someone to become very angry or frustrated.
meanings.sent1: The loud construction noise was maddening to the neighbors.
meanings.sent2: The constant beeping sound was maddening during the exam.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn vending machine was maddeningly refusing to give out snacks.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending traffic jam was maddening like a never-ending nightmare.
meanings.sent5: The dripping faucet was maddening, like a relentless drumbeat in the silence.

meanings.sent1: The slow internet connection was maddening for online gamers.
meanings.sent2: The repetitive music was maddening to the listeners.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was maddeningly stealing all the birdseed.
meanings.sent4: The tangled headphones were maddening, like a puzzle with no solution.
meanings.sent5: The itchy mosquito bites were maddening, making it impossible to sleep peacefully.
